data.title: Obituaries – Metropolitan Funeral
data.text:
Obituaries

Veronica T. Adams

April 4, 1984 - August 11, 1984

Born Veronica Tynia Adams, on April 4th, 1984 to mother Sharron, and father Geoffrey Sr. Veroninca was the over energized 2nd of 3 girls. Roots beginning in Washington D.C., instilled in Veronica was a love for the “city”, and great music! Veronica had a passion for drawing and coloring, she truly saw the beauty in ALL THINGS! If she could, she’d give all she owned, just to see someone smile. Regardless of the hurtles life threw her way, she could, and would, always fine strength, mixed with positivity in all things. Veronica will be remembered for her infectious smile, her…...

Bert W. Holmes, Jr., M.D.

August 9, 1939 - March 20, 2018

BERT WELLINGTON HOLMES, JR., M.D. (Ret. Brigadier General), was born August 9, 1939, in the Berkley Section of Norfolk, Virginia, to Ruth Hicks Holmes and the late Bert Wellington Holmes, Sr. He learned the meaning of hard work and discipline at an early age with the examples set by his parents and grandparents. Bert graduated from Booker T. Washington High School in Norfolk, VA, Virginia State College (University) in Petersburg (B.S. and M.S.), Howard University College of Medicine (M.D). In 1964, upon graduating from Virginia State University ROTC, Bert was commissioned as a second lieutenant in the army infantry branch.…...

Dominique Lydia Payton

February 17, 1992 - March 24, 2018

Dominique Lydia Payton was brought into this world to be one of the greatest additions to the Payton family on February 17, 1992. Her arrival was a godsend. She spent her early years in South Hempstead, New York, where she attended Covert Elementary. After the Payton family moved to the Virginia area, Dominique furthered her education at H.H. Poole Middle School and Chancellor High School. Following her intermediate schooling, Dominique attended Virginia State University. It was there that her refusal to be put into a box became apparent. Dominique made it very clear that her passion to be a chef…...

William L. McCoy

December 21, 1949 - March 24, 2018

William L. McCoy was born December 21, 1949 in Norfolk, VA to the late William H. Lindsey and Inez McCoy and raised by the late John and Helen Custis. William was a member of Church of Christ and loved spreading the word of God throughout the community. William McCoy affectionately known as “Pep” or “Zep” to many departed this life on March 24, 2018. He was preceded in death by a special and close friend, Della M. Williams; son, George Wilson; siblings, Cora Jones, Della Wilson, Raymond Jackson and Clee Allen Jackson. He leaves to cherish his loving memory his…...

Thomasine Whitaker

February 18, 1957 - March 27, 2018

Thomasine Whitaker, peacefully slipped into eternal rest in the early morning hours on Tuesday, March 27, 2018 with is niece, shinelle Whitaker holdin his hand. Thomasine Whitaker, known as “Gator” or “Chief”, was born to the late Mary Whitaker-Chandler and Lonnie Whitaker, Sr. on February 18, 1957. Thomasine attended Maury High School where he was active in sports playing both Football and on the Wresting team. After high school, Thomasine served in the United States Army and eventually found his calling as a Cement Finisher, learning from the best, his step-father, Aaron. Thomasine was the light of every party; making…...

Janet Alexander

February 5, 1951 - March 29, 2018

Janet Marie Yvonne Alexander peacefully transitioned from glory to reward on March 29, 2018. Predeceased by Mother Marie Polly Virgil and Father Lester Westmore Virgil. Leaves behind Uncle Allan Virgil (Valerie), Uncle Alfonzo (Sandra) and Aunt Grace. She was a mother of four Mark, Falon, Chloe and Fiona, she also served as a ‘Mother’ to many. Whenever there was a need, Jet(as she was affectionately called) filled it. Whether it was opening her door to a family that home burned down and raising a ten year old niece (Kenya Wright) as her own daughter into adulthood, the word ‘No’ was not in her vocabulary. Jet was also President of…...

Evelyn Breathwaite

April 28, 1923 - March 30, 2018

Evelyn M. Owens Breathwaite departed this life peacefully, Friday, March 30, 2018. Evelyn was born on April 28, 1923 in Princess Anne County, Virginia to the late Frank and Maud Owens; she was 94 years old. Evelyn graduated from Princess Anne County Training School June 1940, where she was also the class secretary. While in high school, Evelyn met John Rodney Breathwaite, who affectionately called her “Chum”. After graduation, she moved to Baltimore, Maryland to attend Cosmetology School, returning to Virginia Beach to marry the love of her life, John Rodney Breathwaite. To this union was born five sons and…...

Carrie E. Holloway

February 15, 1942 - March 30, 2018

Carrie Evalina Holloway “Mother”. as she was also affectionately known by, received her wings on Friday, March 30, 2018. Carrie was born February 15, 1942 in Norfolk, Virginia to the late Alphonso and Carrie Stepney. She was also preceded in death by her four brothers, Willie, Alphonso, Jr., Charles and John Arthur Stepney and one sister, Arveria Everett. She attended Norfolk Public Schools and completed her education at Booker T. Washington High School. “Mother” was also extremely active in her community, serving as an environmental specialist for many years. Helping other was something that was very important to “Mother” as…...

Bernard Timothy Small, Sr.

June 21, 1959 - March 30, 2018

On Friday, March 30, 2018, Bernard Timothy Small, Sr., returned to his heavenly home. He was a devoted father, grandfather, brother, uncle, cousin, great uncle and friend. Bernard aka (Timmy/Timothy), was born to the late Bishop Thomas J. Small and the late Evangelist Ruth Ann Small. He gave his life to Christ at an early age and attended his father’s church Phillippi COGIC. He was a member of the church choir and played drums, saxophone and loved music. Timothy attended Portsmouth Public School System and furthered his education after receiving his High School diploma. After graduation, Timothy was employed by Portsmouth Public Works. Timothy enrolled in a…...

July 20, 1955 - April 1, 2018

Michael Lee Wilkins (Poke) transitioned into eternal life on Easter Sunday, April 1, 2018. Michael was born July 20, 1955 In Norfolk, Virginia to James and Ellen Wilson-Wilkins, He was the youngest of five children. Michael was predeceased by his mother and father, brother Harold James Wilkins, grandparents, William B. Wilson, Elijah Hairston, Sr. and Gertrude Wilson. Michael was educated in Norfolk Public Schools. He later joined the Job Corp and was offered as scholarship to Tennessee State University because of his athletic abilities. To this day his friends often speak of what a great basketball player he was. Rather…...

Clarence Henderson Smallwood

June 30, 1946 - April 3, 2018

Clarence H. (Coy) Smallwood departed this world on April 3, 2018. He was born June 30,1946 to the late Dorothy and Jimmy Smallwood in Bertie County, North Carolina. Clarence moved to Norfolk,Virginia as a young child. He received his education in Norfolk Public Schools including Booker T. Washington High School. Later he joined the United States Army and served as a Paratrooper. Clarence had many fond memories of his time in the service. Routinely having multiple jobs simultaneously, Clarence was known as a hard worker. He began working as a young boy delivering groceries. He spent summers doing farm work…...

Sean Kiara Spratling, known as “Sprat”, transitioned from Earth to gain his heavenly wings on Tuesday, April 3, 2018. He was born on March 14, 1989 to Willie and Lee Ann (formly) Spratling in Norfolk, VA. Sean received his early education through Chesapeake Public Schools. He graduated from Atlantic Shores Christian Academy in 2007, He loved sports thereby he played football with Oscar Smith as well as Atlantic Shores Christian School in Virginia Beach, VA. Thereafter, he received his Bachelor of Science degree from Norfolk State University majoring in Entrepreneurship in May 2015. Sean spent the past 16 years of…...

Julian William Barrett

November 1, 2017 - April 4, 2018

Julian William Barrett was born to Keyunda Steele and Lester Barrett on November 1, 2017 at 1:18pm, weighting 6lb and 8oz of love and was 18 inches long. “JuJu” is what everyone loved to call him. The world’s happiest baby. Julian had the chubbiest cheeks that both his mommy and daddy loved to kiss, and a smile and laugh that was contagious that warmed everyone’s heart. He loved his sisters touch and closeness and even story time. Julian loved watching TV and playing with his grandma and grandpa (Angela and Jeffery Barrett). Julian and his dad shared a bond like any other; he loved laughing and “talking”…...

July 1, 1961 - April 5, 2018

On April 5th 2018, God called his child Melinda H. Jemison home. Melinda was the third of four children, born on July 1st, 1961 to Doris J. Harrison and the late Bernard C. Harrison in Norfolk, Va. She was raised in Portsmouth Va. and graduated from Portsmouth Catholic High School in 1979. She received her Bachelor of Social Work (BSW) from Norfolk State University in 1997; and later went on to receive her Masters of Social Work (MSW) in 2000 from the same University. September 15, 1928 - April 7, 2018

Georgiana Peace McClease was called home to be with our Lord and Savior on Saturday, April 7, 2018. On September 15, 1958, Georgiana was born in Henderson, North Carolina. At the age of 16, she relocated to Norfolk, Virginia where she began to make her mark. She began a career as a coat finisher at Finklstein’s. Georgiana enjoyed nature, cooking and celebrating with her beloved ones. At a family gathering you would find her on the dance floor. She had a heart of gold and a spirit so bright. She would spread her joy wherever she went. Georgiana Peace McClease…...

She grew up in the neighborhoods of Bowling Park and Park Place, and for many years she attended New Calvary Baptist Church in Norfolk, VA. She graduated from Maury High School in 1970. She retired from the City of Norfolk Social Services. Vanessa is survived by a fiancée, Raymond Caldeyro, Jr. and his family; her sons, Ronald (Brenda) Redmond and Vance (Ayanna) Redmond; two grandchildren; her stepdaughter, Lytanja Smith; her…...

Washington High School where she participated in many clubs and was a member of the cheerleading squad. Michael was a private person but he had a big heart and loved his family dearly. He would spend nights up late talking with his sister about “Back in the Day”. Children Isaiah Howard Jr. and Gwendolyn Brathwaite. Grandson Carl Headen. Mary worked at the Veteran’s Administration Hospital in Lyons, NJ well over 10 years as well as other various jobs. LaGretta M. Hammond passed away peacefully April 11, 2018. She was born in Norfolk, VA. She was a graduate of Booker T. Washington High School class of 1963 and loved the marching band. She was a die hard Dallas Cowboys fan and an avid Bingo player. She was the owner of “A Touch of Patience” shared housing and also retired as the Director of Security of Lake Taylor Hospital in Norfolk, VA. LaGretta was predeceased by her parents, Charlie and Virginia Dickens; sister, Ruth Davis; brothers, Isaac Jarman, Alton Batts and Charles Dickens; husband, Manuel N. Hammond, Sr. and Marilyn…...

June 15, 1927 - April 11, 2018

Mary John Williams Porter transitioned into internal rest early Wednesday morning, April 11, 2018 at Maryveiw Nursing Care Center. Mary was born on June 15, 1927 to Herman Williams, Sr. and Della Crocker Williams in Courtland (South Hampton County), VA. Mary was the second born into a family of seven children and her father passed away when she was ten years old. Mary had to become a great help to her mom taking care of her siblings and working on the family farm. She married her husband, Stanley C. Porter and after they had their sons, they first moved to Suffolk, VA to work and raise their…...

June 17, 1928 - April 11, 2018

Kenneth Marcell Givens, Sr. (Papa “G”) of Norfolk, Virginia, passed away on April 11, 2018. Kenneth was born June 17, 1928 in Sussex County, Virginia to Eugene and Cleo Givens. He attended St. Joseph Catholic School and years later continued his education at Book T. Washington High School Class of 1965. Kenneth proudly served for five years in the U.S. Army and participated in the Korean War where he was wounded and then reassigned back to the United States. Kenneth was awarded a Purple Heart for his bravery by President Harry Truman while being treated at the Naval Medical Center…...

His latter years in life afforded him travel to many vacation destinations and he was an…...

Audrey Anita Carrington age 62, departed this life on Thursday, April 12, 2018. Audrey Anita Poole was born October 26, 1955, to the union of Mamie Selby and John Poole, Sr. in Norfolk, VA. At a young age she married the true love of her life Roy Carrington, Sr. in which this union was for 45 years. Audrey was a loving devoted wife and mother. Her employment throughout the years was an Operator in 29 Palms, CA at the Marine Corp Base as well as at the Army Base in Illinois. After high school, Derrickworked many different jobs and worked at his last job Tidewater Staffing for many years. At Derrick’s last job he helped a lot of people with getting employment and he took pride in doing what he loved to do. Derrick had a love for his motorcycle, crabbing, cooking on the grill and spending time with his family. Derrick was a great father and step father. Derrick loved spending time with his nephews. At a very early age she accepted Christ as her savior and was baptized as a member of Christian Home Baptist Church. Mrs. Joyce Crews attended Currituck Union and graduated as Valedictorian. She attended Camelot Elementary, Deep Cree Junior High and graduated from Deep Creek High all in Chesapeake, VA. She played volleyball, basketball and ran track in school. She later met and married Maurice Boney, Sr. from that union they had three children. Ositee, Maurice Jr., and Xion Boney all of VA Beach and one grandson Kingston M. Boney.
